title: Ferguson protests continue after second police shooting | World news | The Guardian
summary: second man killed by police named .
leaders call end to march , schedule grand jury protest .
grand jury into brown shooting scheduled .

text: we 're bringing our live coverage of ferguson to an end for now .
after an hour or so of chaos , police have allowed people to walk through police lines and head home .
the situation is now much calmer , but confusion about exactly what happened , and what tactics the police were employing , remain .

there is a general consensus that a dramatic response by authorities was prompted by someone throwing a bottle from within the protest crowds , shortly after the protest was called to an end by organisers .
the last few hours ' events were much calmer than previous nights .

the oft-mentioned outside aggressors '' that protesters and their supporters are quick to distance themselves from , were seen trying to prompt reactions from police , including , allegedly throwing rocks .
self-designated peacekeepers worked to move on these people .
one person was seen being put into an ambulance .
a number of people were witnessed being arrested , including a couple of journalists and one legal observer .
there was no tear gas or rubber bullets used by police , according to reports .
protesters have scheduled another protest outside the office of st louis prosecutor bob mcculloch on wednesday morning .
a grand jury process will begin at 9am , investigating the death of michael brown .
the name of a 23-year-old man shot to death by st louis police on monday night was also released a few hours ago .
kajieme powell was allegedly wielding a knife when he was fatally shot by police .
his death sparked a second , smaller bout of protests , with some ferguson protesters moving to st louis .
the deaths are not connected .
pervaiz shallwani ( @ pervaizistan ) protests appear to ended for night .
a few stragglers remain .
officers now standing down , helping people w/ cars in closed zone .
# ferguson
the situation is chaotic , with protesters and media hemmed in by fences and police vehicles , but being told to move on or face arrest .

police have reportedly raised their guns at people and there are numerous images and videos of people who have been maced , but there are no substantiated reports of tear gas used or shots fired - both of which had been utilised by this time in previous nights .
the parking lot has been mostly cleared , according to reports .
police are telling people to move to an intersection at the end of the street .
for those who say they live in the opposite direction , police will check their id at the intersection and will then let them walk back the other way to their homes .
rory carroll ( @ rorycarroll72 ) police snatching and arresting individuals from crowd outside mcdonald 's .
crowd not happy .
# ferguson
one person is being put into an ambulance .
a few minutes ago police moved in on a crowd of protesters and journalists gathered outside the mcdonalds .
around half a dozen people appear to have been arrested .
vice reports that one of the people being arrested appears to be a legal observer , who is wearing a green hat which they ty use to identify themselves .
the report matches up with ryan devereaux 's earlier tweet .
ryan devereaux ( @ rdevro ) the commando cops who shot and arrested me last night just arrested a national lawyers guild observer
over a live stream cries of please , please '' could be heard , followed by a shout to point your guns down '' and the sounds of a dog barking .
over a loudspeaker police continue to instruct credentialed media to leave the area .
earlier an unnamed photographer has been arrested , according to the huffington post 's ryan reilly .
other media have reported seeing at least another six people arrested and put in police vans .
ryan j. reilly ( @ ryanjreilly ) photographer arrested # ferguson
at least two people have been arrested .
journalists have been told to leave the street and go to their designated area , or they too will be arrested .
there 's a lot of discussion about the presence of journalists at ferguson .

police are telling media to leave or stop filming , with some suggestion that aggressors in the crowd might be performing for the cameras , but multiple reporters have been asked by protesters to keep the cameras rolling .
a couple of journalists have made the comment that there appears to be more of them than there are protesters tonight .
addition : some people are embedding '' with the journalists inside their designated area , evidently for safety .
police have at least once , swept into the area to remove people .
we want the world to see that st louis knows how to take care of business , '' a pastor told crowds as he led them in a prayer earlier .
the protest leaders called an end to the demonstrations a short time ago , but the situation has since gotten violent .
below are some excerpts .
we do matter .
every one of you .
he says there has been no injury , no loss of life .
we ask you to intervene right now .
we believe that you are able .
right now we cry out for your help .
we need you right now .
you said when we cry you would answer .
god we expect it , god we believe it bring us together . ''
the marching has well and truly begun again , with a crowd of people walking along a sidewalk unimpeded by police , chanting hands up , do n't shoot . ''
the view of this march , from a livestream , does not appear to be the same area where interactions with police flared up a short time ago .
media have been ordered back to their designated area , as the below video shows .
police told journalists to turn off their lights , protesters urged media to keep them turned on .
ryan j. reilly ( @ ryanjreilly ) the scene in # ferguson

documents.title: bottle thrown , situation escalates
text: someone has launched a water bottle at police , prompting an agitated police reaction .
there are reports of mace , and rubber bullets being fired at people .
one journalists reports rocks have been thrown .
police ran at protesters shouting at them to get off the streets .
protesters have linked arms to hold back aggressors , according to reports .
there 's an allegation that police have again pointed their guns at demonstrators and journalists .
ryan devereaux ( @ rdevro ) heating up .
this officer just pointed his gun at many protesters and journalists julie bosman ( @ juliebosman ) police shouting and advancing rapidly .
lots of activity .
sirens , shouting .

# ferguson yamiche alcindor ( @ yamiche ) tactical units are back and police are telling protesters to disperse robert klemko ( @ robertklemko ) peaceful protesters make a line with their arms , holding off irate protesters from police .

documents.title: second man killed by police named
text: the 23-year-old man who was shot and killed by police after allegedly wielding a knife has been named as kajieme powell , reports chris campbell .

documents.title: leaders call end to march , schedule grand jury protest
text: protest leaders have addressed the crowd and told people to go home .
they led the crowd in a prayer and called for people to change the things they can '' and to have the wisdom to know when we ca n't '' .

the crowd then chanted say it loud , i 'm black and i 'm proud , '' and hands up , do n't shoot '' , before announcing a protest planned for wednesday morning outside the justice centre , when the grand jury will convene to investigate the michael brown shooting .
in the last 30 minutes or so police appeared to change tactics , lining the streets and keeping protesters confined to the sidewalks .
it 's not clear yet how many protesters will now go home , or if there is likely to be an escalation with police .
a live feed is showing some people dispersing but not everyone .
wesley lowery ( @ wesleylowery ) organizers requested to be allowed to gather people for a prayer to end protest .
man on police radio : `` and i told them absolutely not ''
police have started randomly '' clearing people from parking lots , and helicopters are spotlighting individuals , according to numerous reporters .
christopher hayes ( @ chrislhayes ) will say this : police have genuinely tried different tactics just about every night
some quick analysis from washington post reporter , wesley lowery , on the reason for calmer scenes right now , despite it being around the time that the situation has escalated on previous nights .
wesley lowery ( @ wesleylowery ) tonight decision by police to not line up in standoff formation & to not strictly enforce `` no standing '' rule seems to be making difference
the streets of ferguson are calm , barring that earlier fight , reporters on the ground are saying .
the national guard are staying clear of the main street , and the ( still quite large ) protest group is marching peacefully .
there is a second protest in the neighbourhood where police shot a man who was allegedly wielding a knife .
there is n't much news coming from that area , but tensions are reportedly still high .
rory carroll ( @ rorycarroll72 ) 'we young , we strong , we pushing all night long ' nary a hooligan in sight .
# ferguson people with peacekeeper '' written on their shirt are walking among the crowd , helping to cool down any tense situations .
the us attorney general , eric holder , has pleaded with protesters to condemn looting and violence , and with police not to use force in inappropriate ways '' .
we understand the need for an independent investigation , and we hope that the independence and thoroughness of our investigation will bring some measure of calm to the tensions in ferguson .
in order to begin the healing process , however , we must first see an end to the acts of violence in the streets of ferguson .

although these acts have been committed by a very small minority he also said law enforcement bodies should reflect the diversity of the communities they serve , a reference to a statistic oft-cited recently that the population of ferguson is 67 % african-american , but the police force is 94 % white .
this is my pledge to the people of ferguson : our investigation into this matter will be full , it will be fair , and it will be independent .

and beyond the investigation itself , we will work with the police , civil rights leaders , and members of the public to ensure that this tragedy can give rise to new understanding you can read holder 's full op-ed for the st louis post-dispatch here .
a scuffle between protesters has been broken up by police .
pictures below from the guardian 's rory carroll .

rory carroll ( @ rorycarroll72 ) in space of 30 seconds this scuffle between # ferguson protestors led to rory carroll ( @ rorycarroll72 ) # ferguson rory carroll ( @ rorycarroll72 ) # ferguson rory carroll ( @ rorycarroll72 ) 'show over , move away . '
# ferguson

governor nixon has said he will not be replacing st louis county prosecutor bob mcculloch , despite calls from protesters , as it could create potential legal uncertainty '' and may affect any future prosecution , reports st louis public radio .
i am not asking st. louis county prosecutor bob mcculloch to recuse himself from this case , '' nixon said .
there is a well-established process by which a prosecutor can recuse themselves from a pending investigation , and a special prosecutor be appointed .
departing from this established process could unnecessarily inject legal uncertainty into this matter and potentially jeopardize the prosecution . ''

from local journalist chris campbell , reporting for the guardian : mcculloch 's impartiality has come under fire from some local politicians , including outgoing st louis county executive charlie dooley .
dooley has called for missouri attorney general chris koster to replace mcculloch with a special prosecutor , citing concerns in the black community about mcculloch 's objectivity .
the acrimony between the two men became acute during this summer 's political primary season .
mcculloch , whose father was murdered by a black man , endorsed dooley 's victorious opponent in the august 5 democratic primary for st louis .
county executive mcculloch appeared in commercials during the campaign accusing the dooley administration of corruption .

journalist , ryan devereaux , at the intercept has written about the events that led up to his arrest on monday night , including allegedly being shot with a rubber bullet by police while he was walking with his hands up .
the shooting left a mean bruise , but all the guns trained on us provided an ample distraction from the sting .
we were frightened .
the police , who made no verbal commands that we had heard , had clearly demonstrated their willingness to shoot us .
with several similarly armed and approaching officers directly in front of us , we dove behind a car , expecting more shooting .
the police came upon us with their guns pointed directly at us .
we continued repeating that we were journalists .
they pulled us out from behind the car , walked us to their armored vehicles , and zip-tied our hands behind our backs .
he described the other men they were imprisoned with , drawing the conclusion that people are unlikely to give up on protest action any time soon .
read the full article here .

documents.title: grand jury into brown shooting scheduled
text: missouri attorney general chris koster has told media and people on the ground in ferguson that a grand jury hearing will be convened at 9am wednesday , according to reports .

the missouri governor , jay nixon , has posted a video address , speaking of a community engulfed in grief , anger fear , and at times violence '' and the apparent presence of outside agitators '' among otherwise peaceful protest crowds .

he said the shooting of brown and the ten days of protests which followed has ripped open old wounds that have festered for generations , and exposed difficult issues that communities across our country must still resolve . ''
he said that amid all the pain , there is still distrust and anger . ''
we 've also seen tremendous acts of grace courage and kindness as the people of ferguson try to maintain peace while they call for justice for the family of michael brown .
nixon spoke of armed and violent instigators , but said people standing up against them were the faces and soul of missouri . ''
he said police officers are united '' to work and protect the public but at the same time preserving citizens rights to express their anger peacefully '' .

it is not an easy balance to strike and becomes much more difficult in the dark of night , when organised and increasingly violent instigators take to the streets intent on creating chaos and lawlessness . ''
he called on local prosecutors and the us attorney general to meet their obligation to achieve justice for brown 's family thoroughly promptly and correctly . ''
the attorney general of missouri , chris koster , has arrived in ferguson .
he 's expected to be joined by the us attorney general eric holder , who has been dispatched by president obama to supervise the federal investigation into the mike brown shooting .
police captain ron johnson is visiting with ferguson residents .
he earlier on tuesday responded to reports that outside agitators '' are thought to be behind much of the looting and vandalism .
as i mentioned earlier , 93 % of arrests made on monday and monday night were of people from outside ferguson .
our innocent people need for a moment to go into their homes and not allow this criminal element to hide behind them , '' johnson said .
christina coleman ( @ christinaksdk ) riding with capt .
ron johnson as he visits with neighbors along west florissant tonight # ferguson # mikebrown
a large crowd of protesters holding signs is marching and chanting hands up do n't shoot '' .
the st louis county police department has released details on the arrests made in the 24 hours to 8am tuesday .
it says there were 52 arrests made , the bulk of which was for refusal to disperse . ''
there was also one arrest for possession of a controlled substance , two for warrants/failure to appear , and one for interfering with a police officer .
it is of note that 93 % of those arrested were not ferguson residents .
of all those arrested , 27 % were not residents of missouri , '' said the spokesman .
the fbi has flooded the area '' with agents , fbi director james comey has told the agency 's civil rights investigation into the shooting of mike brown .
comey did not provide details on the investigation which involves some 40 fbi agents , but asked for witnesses to come forward and speak to them about the shooting , ap reports .
armoured police vehicles and state troopers are on site at a local ferguson market parking lot.the number of protesters has increased , with large crowds now marching .
as the sun begins to set , the first arrests for the evening have begun .
there are unconfirmed reports of someone detained for praying , and the arrest of a photojournalist , however these are not substantiated yet .
the rules around the protest are very strict , protesters risk arrest if they step off the footpath .
yamiche alcindor ( @ yamiche ) a man is put in a police car .
it 's not police , but the people they are trying to detain , who can stop it turning into a tragedy , says sunil dutta in the washington post .
dutta is a 17-year member of the lapd and a professor of homeland security , and outlines the threats made to police , and the tactics available to them to disarm a situation .

read the whole piece , but here are two excerpts : even though it might sound harsh and impolitic , here is the bottom line : if you do n't want to get shot , tased , pepper-sprayed , struck with a baton or thrown to the ground , just do what i tell you .
do n't argue with me , do n't call me names , do n't tell me that i ca n't stop you , do n't say i 'm a racist pig , do n't threaten that you 'll sue me and take away my badge .
do n't scream at me that you pay my salary , and do n't even think of aggressively walking towards me .
most field stops are complete in minutes .
how difficult is it to cooperate for that long ?

but if you believe ( or know ) that the cop stopping you is violating your rights or is acting like a bully , i guarantee that the situation will not become easier if you show your anger and resentment .
worse , initiating a physical confrontation is a sure recipe for getting hurt .
police are legally permitted to use deadly force when they assess a serious threat to their or someone else 's life .
save your anger for later , and channel it appropriately .
do what the officer tells you to and it will end safely for both of you .
we have a justice system in which you are presumed innocent ; if a cop can do his or her job unmolested , that system can run its course .
later , you can ask for a supervisor , lodge a complaint or contact civil rights organizations if you believe your rights were violated .
feel free to sue the police !
just do n't challenge a cop during a stop .
protest marches continue , with small groups of people marching down west florissant , a major street which a short time ago police said they will be closing to through traffic .
below you can see the notice from police , which others have pointed out appears to be separating media from protesters .
stl public radio ( @ stlpublicradio ) inbox : from the mo .
highway patrol about closure of w. florissant , new assembly & media areas # ferguson antonio french ( @ antoniofrench ) marching in # ferguson
guardian reporter chris mcgreal is at the scene of the second police shooting .
he 's spoken to residents who are unhappy that police shot and killed the man , rather than disarming him , and that white police officers appear to have been sent away from the area .
chris mcgreal ( @ chrismcgreal ) doris davis , witness to latest st louis shooting : if he had a knife they cd hve shot him in leg .
did n't need to kill chris mcgreal ( @ chrismcgreal ) protesters at latest shooting in st louis say white cops responsible whisked away and replaced by black cops to maintain order .
not happy .
la times reporter matt pearce has been keeping a tally of people shot during the ten days of protests .
matt pearce ( @ mattdpearce ) at least seven people have been shot in ferguson during protests or street clashes : tuesday ( 8/12 ) : 2 saturday : 1 sunday : 2 monday : 2
welcome to our continuing coverage of events in ferguson .
you can read the latest wrap here , and the previous live blog here .
here 's a summary of where things stand : .
police fatally shot a 23-year-old african american man near ferguson in st louis on tuesday afternoon .
st louis police chief sam dotson said the man was wielding a knife and behaving erratically before the shooting..
us attorney general eric holder pledged that the federal government 's investigation will be fair '' and independent '' in an editorial posted on the st louis post-dispatch website .
he said he supports peaceful protests but condemned the very small minority '' creating violence..
this comes a day ahead of holder 's expected arrival in ferguson .

fbi and department of justice employees have been canvassing ferguson and working with community leaders as part of the federal investigation into the shooting.. a public memorial for michael brown will be held on monday , his family announced .
the time and location of the service has not been released.. a grand jury will hear evidence on the shooting of michael brown on wednesday , according to the washington post .
we know this is of interest to a lot of people around the country , '' edward magee , a spokesperson for the office of st louis county prosecuting attorney robert mcculloch..
the city of ferguson issued a plea for nighttime quiet and reconciliation '' following the previous night 's protests , which saw at least 78 people arrested .
despite intervention by the national guard , law enforcement could not quell the chaos at last night 's demonstrations .
follow the guardian 's rory carroll ( @ rorycarroll72 ) , and chris mcgreal ( @ chrismcgreal ) ongoing reporting from ferguson .

bulletin.text: A 23-year-old man has been fatally shot by St Louis police who said he was wielding a knife, as 52 are arrested in continuing protests after the shooting death of unarmed Mike Brown.
St Louis police shoot 'erratic' man with knife near Ferguson.
Ferguson officials call for calm after 52 arrested.
Outsiders spread unrest and unease in pursuit of eclectic aims.
Comment: help the world hear your racial profiling story.
